title: Mung bean
summary: The mung bean (Vigna radiata), alternatively known as the green gram, maash (Persian: ماش‎), moong[2] (from Sanskrit: मुद्ग, romanized: mudga),  monggo, or munggo (Philippines), is a plant species in the legume family.[3][4] The mung bean is mainly cultivated in East, Southeast and South Asia.[5] It is used as an ingredient in both savoury and sweet dishes.
